title: Move from gmail to tbird
content:
I used Thunderbird for a lot of years, and I liked it. A few months ago my ISP blew up and died, and I had to reconfigure everything for a new ISP. I figured Gmail was a decent email-storage ISP, and I'd use Tbird for the email client. That's what I did with my old ISP.

My laptop was 8 years old, so when my ISP died I got a new one. I assumed I'd be able to copy the Data folder onto my new laptop, and point my new Tbird at it. That's basically what I did the last time I got a new laptop. No such luck, the new Tbird doesn't see the old config or message history. Not sure why. So I started using Gmail's mailer interface. Bad mistake. I HATE Gmail, specifically the Gmail web interface.

Ideally I would like to copy my Tbird history onto my new laptop, merge the old Tbird messages with the Gmail history from the last few months, and move onto Tbird for day-to-day use. I see many messages suggesting conversion processes, but I'm confused by the OAuth issues &etc, and I'm not sure if/how I can do the merge. Help?
creator: garyfritzz

title: Outlook Calendar and Contact Sync – When Will It Be Available?
content:
Hello Thunderbird community,

I’ve been exploring Thunderbird’s integration options and noticed that while email sync with Outlook accounts works fine, calendar and contact synchronization with Outlook/Exchange Online is currently unavailable.

This is a significant limitation for users who rely on Outlook’s ecosystem for scheduling and address book management. I’d like to ask:

Is there an official roadmap for when Outlook calendar sync will be supported in Thunderbird?

Will Outlook contacts sync be added at the same time, or as a separate feature?

I believe many users would benefit from clarity on this, since full Outlook integration is critical for those working in Microsoft-centric environments.

Thanks in advance to the Thunderbird team and volunteers for any updates or guidance.
creator: stank-appease-tug

title: Adresboek in Thunderbird is leeg
content:
De adressenboek in thunderbird is leeg. Ik had nog een csv bestand met de meeste adressen, en ik kan dit importeren. Werkt.

Maar...

Na een herstart van Thunderbird is de adressenboek wederom leeg. Het lijkt er op dat Thunderbird de adressenboek niet meer kan lezen.

Want nu kan ik ook geen import meer starten in de standaard persoonlijke adressenlijst. En moet ik een nieuwe aanmaken.

Info: 146.0.1 (64-bits) Uitgaveopmerkingen Thunderbird Beta is up-to-date U gebruikt momenteel het release-updatekanaal.

Hij zegt hierboven Beta versie. Maar die heb ik niet geinstalleerd.

Dank bij voorbaat.

title: Won't display any read / saved emails
content:
Using Thunderbird 128.8.1 on Windows 10 (yes, I know). Have used Thunderbird for many years, with thousands of saved messages in local folders.

When I started the program this morning, no previously "Read" messages of any kind (local or online) appeared in any folder -- just the new, Unread messages in the Inbox. If I read a new message and then go on to another one, the first message also disappears, whether I leave it in the Inbox or move it to another folder.

In Troubleshooting Mode, all the "Read" messages show up, so they're clearly still accessible. I feel like I must have accidentally toggled a switch not to display "Read" messages -- but not sure how to reverse the process.

Thanks for any help!
creator: borisgoodenough

title: Thunderbird has decided to spell my name wrongly after automatic transfer to a new computer.
content: I have just transferred my Thunderbird email data to a new computer. Now in the listing of emails received it shows my name wrongly spelt. I can't find anywhere in my transferred account settings where this spelling mistake actually occurs. It is the kind of mistake that a native speaker of English would make when they see my name. How can Thunderbird have made this mistake in a completely automatic transfer? Disturbing and unnerving. Is this AI deciding that I spell my own name wrongly maybe? Please help if you can.

title: Server outlook.office365.com responded with an error
content:
After the 146.0.1 update (installed on December 10th, 2025, OS: Windows 11 25H2), when Thunderbird tries syncing a college email account (email format: first.last@schoolname.schoolabbreviation.edu) I get the following error message popup as a Windows notification: "Server outlook.office365.com responded with an error." When clicking on the error message, it doesn't provide any additional information (no error code or detailed message of what's going on).

Below is the troubleshooting steps I have already tried.

  • Restarted computer
  • Repaired Thunderbird installation
  • Tested connection to server under Account Settings>Server Settings. Shows successful connection.
  • Cleared Thunderbird startup cache

Since the account still seems to send and receive emails just fine, I haven't tried removing/readding the account or doing an uninstall/reinstall of Thunderbird.

Any suggestions on where I can find details of what is causing this error and how to fix it? If I need to provide more troubleshooting information, please let me know.
creator: jditter00

title: Thunderbird password
content: After many years for whatever reason I decided to change my log in password using Thunderbird with Ionos.com and my S23 Samsung and my Windows 10. This was Saturday December 25, 2025. On same day my S23 and my email account using Ionos.com stopped receiving email sent to my Thunderbird email account. I called Samsung they were of no help except to change my password and tell me to log in again in an hour. This was done while my account was maybe still being looked at by Samsung helper. Today is Sunday what worries me a bit is everything in my email account could still be seen by technician who helped me or anyone else. I went for help this morning at Best Buy. Not much help. I tried to log into my Thunderbird and do not see my password and not sure if I should in using my Firefox log in. I am not receiving any emails to my email account on my windows 10 or S23. Please help be with what to do. And something else. How will I get reply if it is an email and I cannot see it??????????? Thanks

title: New Issue with Win ver. 146.0.1 -- Deleting Spam Folder Now Sends Spam To Trash! BAD!
content:
Oy! If it isn't one thing, it's another:

Before this latest update (earlier this week), when I right-clicked on my Spam folder (int left column of the screen), the drop-down box would open. Then when I left-clicked "Empty Spam", all of the Spam folder messages were *permanently deleted.*

But now? They go into Trash and I cannot figure out a way to change this behavior. I should not have to select all the spam messages and then click <Ctrl> to get rid of them, it should happen when I click "Empty Spam."

How do I solve this/is there anybody there who can fix this?
creator: BobbyBobBob
